org.safs.android.auto.lib

Class Process2

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.safs.android.auto.lib.Process2

  • public class Process2
extends java.lang.Object
    Extends Process by wrapping one.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Process2(java.lang.Process process)
      Default constructor allowing process cleanup on JVM Shutdown.
      Process2(java.lang.Process process, boolean no_shutdown_hook)
      Alternate constructor to allow the prevention of cleanup on JVM Shutdown.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Process2

        public Process2(java.lang.Process process)
        Default constructor allowing process cleanup on JVM Shutdown. This is the same as instancing Process2(process, false)
        Parameters:
        process - object to wrap

      • Process2

        public Process2(java.lang.Process process,
                boolean no_shutdown_hook)
        Alternate constructor to allow the prevention of cleanup on JVM Shutdown. Use this if you need to allow the underlying process to persist after shutdown.
        Parameters:
        process - object to wrap
        no_shutdown_hook - -- true to persist the process beyond JVM shutdown.
        See Also:
        persist

    • Method Detail

      • setPersist

        public void setPersist(boolean doPersist)
        Change the persist status of this process. If persist is being set "true", then we will attempt to remove this process from the cache of processes that will be destroyed upon JVM Shutdown. If persist is being set "false", then we will attempt to add this process to the cache of processes that will be destroyed upon JVM Shutdown.
        Parameters:
        doPersist -

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        destroy() the underlying process IF the flag to persist beyond shutdown is not set. If the flag is not set we will remove this process from the JVM shutdown hook thread and destroy it immediately.
        See Also:
        persist

      • removeJVMShutdownReference

        public void removeJVMShutdownReference()
        Remove this process from the JVM Shutdown Hook thread. This will only succeed if we are not already in JVM shutdown mode.

      • exitValue

        public int exitValue()
        Returns the exit value for the subprocess.
        Returns:
        the exit value of the subprocess represented by this Process object. By convention, the value 0 indicates normal termination.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException - - if the subprocess represented by this Process object has not yet terminated.

      • waitFor

        public Process2 waitFor()
                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Wait/Block for the exitValue/completion from the wrapped Process.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if thrown by the underlying process.
        See Also:
        Process.waitFor()

      • waitFor

        public Process2 waitFor(int secsTimeout)
                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Wait/Block for the exitValue/completion from the wrapped Process up to the provided secsTimeout period.
        Parameters:
        secsTimeout - -- number of seconds to wait before issuing IllegalThreadStateException.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if thrown by the underlying process.
        java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException - if the timeout has been reached without the process having exited.

      • waitForSuccess

        public Process2 waitForSuccess()
                        throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Wait for exitValue (0) from the wrapped Process. If the exitValue is not 0 then the routine will throw a RuntimeException.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if thrown by the underlying process.
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the exitValue is NOT 0 (success).
        See Also:
        waitFor(), Process.waitFor()

      • waitForSuccess

        public Process2 waitForSuccess(int secsTimeout)
                        throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Wait for exitValue (0) from the wrapped Process within the specified timeout period. If the exitValue is not 0 then the routine will throw a RuntimeException.
        Parameters:
        secsTimeout - -- number of seconds to wait before issuing an IllegalThreadStateException.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if thrown by the underlying process.
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the exitValue is NOT 0 (success).
        java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException - if the timeout is reached without process termination.
        See Also:
        waitFor(int)

      • discardStdout

        public Process2 discardStdout()
        Connects Stdout to the internal DEV_NULL sink.
        Returns:
        this (from connectStdout)
        See Also:
        connectStdout(Appendable)

      • discardStderr

        public Process2 discardStderr()
        Connects Stderr to the internal DEV_NULL sink.
        Returns:
        this (from connectStdout)
        See Also:
        connectStderr(Appendable)

      • forwardIO

        public Process2 forwardIO()
        Forward Process Stdin to System.in Also invokes forwardOutput
        Returns:
        this (from forwardOutput())
        See Also:
        forwardOutput()

      • forwardOutput

        public Process2 forwardOutput()
        Forward Process StdOut to System.out and forward StdErr to System.err. Uses connectStdout(System.out); connectStderr(System.err);
        Returns:
        this
